title: ericsson-bsf

ericsson-bsf:bsf-function.description: Configuration settings for the Binding Support Function

nf-instance.description: The BSF instance defines the behavior of the BSF NF as well as the NRF registration behavior

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the BSF instance

nf-peer-info.description: Defines the required data for 3gpp-Sbi-NF-Peer-Info header in a global level

out-message-handling.description: A switch to define the header handling in a global level

nf-instance-id.description: A Universally Unique IDentifier in the string representation defined in RFC 4122. The canonical representation uses lower case characters. The following is an example of a UUID in string representation: f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6 Setting this property is optional. It has a meaning for how the BSF registers in its NRF(s): If not set, an automatically generated NF instance ID (a different one for each NRF group) is used for the registration. If set, this is used for the registration rather than the automatically generated NF instance IDs of the NRF groups.

ip-family-resolution.description: IP family for the DNS resolution of an FQDN

nf-profile.description: Profile consisting of general parameters of the BSF instance and the services provided by it, sent to the NRF at registration

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the NF profile

bsf-info.description: Specific data for the BSF NF

dnn.description: DNN(s) handled by the BSF. If not provided, the BSF can serve any DNN

ip-domain.description: IPv4 address domain(s) handled by the BSF. If not provided, the BSF can serve any IP domain

ipv4-addr-range.description: Range(s) of IPv4 addresses handled by BSF. If not provided, the BSF can serve any IPv4 address

ipv6-prefix-range.description: Range(s) of IPv6 prefixes handled by the BSF. If not provided, the BSF can serve any IPv6 prefix

nf-service.description: The configuration of NF services provided by the BSF which can be discovered by other NFs

service-address-ref.description: Service address of the BSF service

oauth2-required.description: Flag indicating whether the NF instance requires OAuth2-based authorization

service-instance-id.description: Name uniquely identifying this service instance.

service-name.description: Name identifying the type of NF service.

api-prefix.description: Optional path used to construct the API URI for this service

allowed-plmn.description: PLMNs allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs of any PLMN are allowed to access the NF

mcc.description: Specifies the mobile country code of the PLMN

mnc.description: Specifies the mobile network code of the PLMN

allowed-nf-type.description: NF types (according to TS 29.510) which are allowed to access the NF service. If not specified, NFs of any type are allowed to access the NF service.

allowed-nf-domain.description: NF domain names which are allowed to access the NF service. If not specified, If not specified, NFs in any domain are allowed to access the NF

allowed-nssai.description: Deprecated, use allowed-nssai-1 instead. NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the optional slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI

allowed-nssai-1.description: NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI. Special character '-' indicates an unspecified slice differentiator

service-priority.description: Service priority of this NF service relative to other NF services of the same type, to be used for NF service selection. Lower values indicate a higher priority

capacity.description: Static capacity information of this NF service expressed as a weight relative to other services of the same type, to be used for NF selection

recovery-time.description: Timestamp when the NF was (re)started - This attribute is not used.

nf-instance-name.description: Human readable name of the NF instance

nf-type.description: The type of the NF instance (according to TS 29.510)

nf-specific-info.description: Deprecated, use nf-profile->chf-info and nf-profile->bsf-info instead, specific data for the NF instance type

chf-info.description: Specific data for the CHF NF

supi-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of SUPIs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any SUPI

id.description: ID uniquely identifying the SUPI range

supi-start.description: First value identifying the start of a SUPI range, to be used when the range of SUPI's can be represented as a numeric range, IMSI ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

supi-end.description: Last value identifying the end of a SUPI range, to be used when the range of SUPI's can be represented as a numeric range, IMSI ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of SUPIs belonging to this range. A SUPI value is considered part of the range if, and only if, the SUPI string fully matches the regular expression.

gpsi-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of GPSIs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any GPSI

identity-start.description: First value identifying the start of an identity range, to be used when the range of identities can be represented as a numeric range, MSISDN ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

identity-end.description: Last value identifying the end of an identity range, to be used when the range of identities can be represented as a numeric range, MSISDN ranges for example. This string shall consist only of digits.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of identities belonging to this range. An identity value is considered part of the range if and only if the identity string fully matches the regular expression. To be used when identity is External Identifier or External Group Identifier or MSISDN.

plmn-range.description: Specifies the list of ranges of PLMNs that can be served by the CHF instance. If not specified, the CHF can serve any PLMN

plmn-start.description: First value identifying the start of a PLMN range. The string shall be encoded as follows: <MCC><MNC>. For example '12340'.

plmn-end.description: Last value identifying the end of a PLMN range. The string shall be encoded as follows: <MCC><MNC>. For example '12349'.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern representing the set of PLMNs belonging to this range. A PLMN value is considered part of the range if and only if the PLMN string, formatted as <MCC><MNC>, fully matches the regular expression. For example '^1234[0-9]$'

bsf-info.description: Specific data for the BSF NF

requested-heartbeat-timer.description: Requested time, in seconds, expected between two heart-beat messages from the NF instance to the NRF

plmn.description: PLMN(s) of the NF instance. If not provided, the PLMN ID(s) of the PLMN of the NRF are assumed for this NF

mcc.description: Specifies the mobile country code of the PLMN

mnc.description: Specifies the mobile network code of the PLMN

snssai.description: Deprecated, use snssai-1 instead. S-NSSAIs of the NF instance. If present, this attribute represents the list of S-NSSAIs supported in all the PLMNs configured for this NF instance. If not provided, the NF instance can serve any S-NSSAI

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the optional slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI

snssai-1.description: S-NSSAIs of the NF instance. If present, this attribute represents the list of S-NSSAIs supported in all the PLMNs configured for this NF instance. If not provided, the NF instance can serve any S-NSSAI

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI. Special character '-' indicates an unspecified slice differentiator

allowed-plmn.description: PLMNs allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs of any PLMN are allowed to access the NF

mcc.description: Specifies the mobile country code of the PLMN

mnc.description: Specifies the mobile network code of the PLMN

allowed-nf-type.description: NF types (according to TS 29.510) which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs of any type are allowed to access the NF

allowed-nf-domain.description: NF domain names which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any domain are allowed to access the NF

allowed-nssai.description: Deprecated, use allowed-nssai-1 instead. NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the optional slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI

allowed-nssai-1.description: NSSAIs which are allowed to access the NF instance. If not specified, NFs in any NSSAI are allowed to access the NF

sst.description: Specifies the slice service type of the S-NSSAI

sd.description: Specifies the slice differentiator of the S-NSSAI. Special character '-' indicates an unspecified slice differentiator

nf-set-id.description: NF Set Identifiers for this NF used for NF registration

nsi.description: NSI identities of the Network Function. If not provided, the NF can serve any NSI

service-priority.description: Service priority of this NF instance, in the range of 0-65535, relative to other NF instances of the same type, to be used for NF selection. Lower values indicate a higher priority

capacity.description: Static capacity information of this NF instance, in the range of 0-65535, expressed as a weight relative to other NF instances of the same type

locality.description: Operator defined information about the location of the NF instance. This information can be used by requesting NFs which prefer services of those NFs in the same geographical location or data center

recovery-time.description: Timestamp when the NF was (re)started - This attribute is not used.

scp-domain.description: The SCP domain(s) the SCP belongs to or the SCP domain the NF (other than SCP) belongs to

service-address.description: Address of the BSF, referenced in the nf-profile sent to the NRF

ipv4-address.description: IPv4 address of the BSF service

ipv6-address.description: IPv6 address of the BSF service

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the service address.

fqdn.description: FQDN of the nf-service, for example chf.op.com

port.description: This port is used to receive non-TLS traffic.

tls-port.description: This port is used to receive TLS traffic.

oauth2-key-profile.description: The oAuth2 key profile of the BSF

key-id.description: The identifier of the oAuth2 key

type.description: The type of the oAuth2 key profile

alg.description: The encryption algorithm of the oAuth2 key profile. This parameter is necessary for JWK transformation

value.description: The value of the oAuth2 key profile

json-body.description: The json body of the oAuth2 key profile

ingress-connection-profile.description: Connection profile for ingress traffic cases

hpack-table-size.description: Maximum table size (in octets) that the encoder is permitted to use for the dynamic HPACK table. Valid values range from 0 to 4294967295 (2^32 - 1). 0 effectively disables header compression.

dscp-marking.description: DSCP value used for IP packets sent over this connection

nrf-group.description: The NRF group specifies all relevant information of NRFs that are available to this BSF instance. Regarding the Nnrf_NFManagement interface, it determines the NRF registration behavior and triggers the NRF registration for the NF instance specified in the nf-profile.

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the NRF group

nf-instance-id.description: ID uniquely identifying the NF Profile of this BSF instance, given per NRF Group.

dns-profile-ref.description: Reference to a defined dns-profile that will be used for DNS resolution of the FQDN of the NRFs in the NRF group

nf-profile-ref.description: The NF profile with which to register to the NRF for the Nnrf_NFManagement service. If specified, the attributes configured in the NF profile on the individual NRF level will override the corresponding attributes of the NF profile on the NRF group level.

nrf.description: The configuration for a single NRF within this NRF group

nf-profile-ref.description: The NF profile with which to register to the NRF for the Nnrf_NFManagement service. If specified, the attributes configured in the NF profile on the individual NRF level will override the corresponding attributes of the NF profile on the NRF group level.

oauth2-key-profile-ref.description: The oAuth2 key profile for a specific NRF instance id

priority.description: Priority of this NRF for NF registration and other NRF service requests, relative to other NRFs in the same NRF group. In regard to the Nnrf_NFManagement service, the NRF with the highest priority is the primary NRF to which the NF instance will register. The remaining NRFs are used in case of failover, in order of priority. Lower values indicate a higher priority.

scheme.description: Specifies the URI scheme to be used when contacting this NRF

retry-timeout.description: The time duration in milliseconds after which a request is considered unsuccessful and a retry to the same NRF is sent.

max-retries.description: The number of retries sent to the same NRF before failover to another NRF.

nrf-instance-id.description: NRF instance id uniquely identifying the NRF

nrf-service.description: Defines which NRF services are used by this NF instance, referencing groups of NRFs that provide the respective service.

nrf-group-ref.description: The groups of NRFs providing the Nnrf_NFManagement service
The group of NRFs providing the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the BSF service

binding-timeout.description: Obsolete, Session binding expiration timer in hours
Session binding expiration timer in hours. Valid values range from 0 to 65535 (2^16 - 1). 0 effectively uses the default value.

diameter-routing.description: Configuration settings for routing of diameter messages.

lookup-profile.description: The profile used by BSF for routing diameter messages that invoke database lookups.

fallback-destination-realm.description: Destination realm where a diameter message will be routed if the binding database lookup yields no result.

fallback-destination-host.description: Destination host where a diameter message will be routed if the binding database lookup yields no result.

route.description: Route that will be used in forwarded diameter messages.

lookup-profile-ref.description: Reference of a defined lookup profile.

route-type.description: The type of the route to configure.

multiple-binding-resolution.description: Configuration settings for multiple bindings handling.

http-lookup.description: Configuration dedicated for multiple binding handling on http-lookup.

deletion-upon-lookup.description: Deletion based on multiple-binding-resolution for http-lookup.

diameter-lookup.description: Configuration dedicated for multiple binding handling on diameter-lookup.

deletion-upon-lookup.description: Deletion based on multiple-binding-resolution for diameter-lookup.

pcf-recovery-time.description: Configuration settings for cleanups based on pcf recovery time feature.

check-upon-lookup.description: Configuration regarding pcf recovery time during traffic.

deletion-upon-lookup.description: Enable or disable deletion-upon-lookup based on recovery-time.

binding-database-scan.description: Configuration for full table scan feature.

schedule.description: Cron format used to specify schedule time only when configuration is set to scheduled.

vtap.description: Defines the required data for traffic tapping

enabled.description: A switch that allows the operator to enable or disable traffic tapping in a global level

ingress.description: Defines the configuration data required for tapping the BSF service

service-address-ref.description: Reference to the service-address the traffic of which is taken into account for tapping
